{"step_by_step_thinking": "Kiesselbach's plexus is an area in the anterior part of the nasal septum where several arteries converge. The arteries that contribute to Kiesselbach's plexus include the sphenopalatine artery, anterior ethmoidal artery, greater palatine artery, and septal branch of the superior labial artery. To determine which of the options are not a branch of the external carotid artery in Kiesselbach's plexus, we need to identify the arteries that are not branches of the external carotid artery.", "answer_choice": "C"}
